verses.verse: Samuel<WH8050> died;<WH4191> and all Israel<WH3478> gathered themselves together,<WH6908> and lamented<WH5594> him,<WH6912> and buried him in his house<WH1004> at Ramah.<WH7414> David<WH1732> arose,<WH6965> and went down<WH3381> to the wilderness<WH4057> of Paran.<WH6290>

Now the name<WH8034> of the man<WH376> was Nabal;<WH5037> and the name<WH8034> of his wife<WH802> Abigail;<WH26> and the woman<WH802> was of good<WH2896> understanding,<WH7922> and of a beautiful<WH3303> face:<WH8389> but the man<WH376> was churlish<WH7186> and evil<WH7451> in his doings;<WH4611> and he was of the house of Caleb.<WH3614>

You shall tell<WH559> him,<WH2416> <WH7965> 'Long life to you! Peace be to you,<WH7965> and peace be to your house,<WH1004> and peace be to all that you have.<WH7965>

Now I have heard<WH8085> that you have shearers.<WH1494> Your shepherds<WH7462> have now been with us,<WH3637> and we didn't hurt them,<WH3972> neither was there anything missing<WH6485> from them,<WH3117> all the while they were in Carmel.<WH3760>

Ask<WH7592> your young men,<WH5288> and they will tell<WH5046> you.<WH5288> Therefore, let the young men find<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in your eyes;<WH5869> for we come<WH935> in a good<WH2896> day.<WH3117> Please give<WH5414> whatever comes<WH4672> to your hand,<WH3027> to your servants,<WH5650> and to your son<WH1121> David.<WH1732>'"
When David<WH1732>'s young men<WH5288> came,<WH935> they spoke<WH1696> to Nabal<WH5037> according to all those words<WH1697> in the name<WH8034> of David,<WH1732> and ceased.<WH5117>

Nabal<WH5037> answered<WH6030> David<WH1732>'s servants,<WH5650> and said,<WH6030> "Who is David?<WH1732> Who is the son<WH1121> of Jesse?<WH3448> There are many<WH7231> servants<WH5650> who<WH376> break away<WH6555> from<WH6440> their masters<WH113> these days.<WH3117>

Shall I then take<WH3947> my bread,<WH3899> and my water,<WH4325> and my meat<WH2878> that I have killed<WH2873> for my shearers,<WH1494> and give<WH5414> it to men<WH582> who I don't<WH3045> know where they come from?"
So David<WH1732>'s young men<WH5288> turned<WH2015> on their way,<WH1870> and went back,<WH7725> and came<WH935> and told<WH5046> him according to all these words.<WH1697>

David<WH1732> said<WH559> to his men,<WH582> "Every man<WH582> put on<WH2296> his sword!<WH2719>" Every man<WH376> put on<WH2296> his sword.<WH2719> David<WH1732> also put on<WH2296> his sword.<WH2719> About four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> <WH5927> followed<WH310> David;<WH1732> and two hundred<WH3967> stayed<WH3427> by the baggage.<WH3627>

But one<WH259> of the young men<WH5288> told<WH5046> Abigail,<WH26> Nabal<WH5037>'s wife,<WH802> saying,<WH559> "Behold,<WH1732> David sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> out of the wilderness<WH4057> to Greet<WH1288> our master;<WH113> and he railed at them.<WH5860>

But the men<WH582> were very<WH3966> good<WH2896> to us,<WH3637> and we were not hurt, neither missed<WH6485> we anything,<WH3972> as long as<WH3117> we went<WH1980> with them,<WH7704> when we were in the fields.
They were a wall<WH2346> to us both by night<WH3915> and by day,<WH3119> all the while<WH3117> we were with them keeping<WH7462> the sheep.<WH6629>

Now therefore know<WH3045> and consider<WH7200> what you will do;<WH6213> for evil<WH7451> is determined<WH3615> against our master,<WH113> and against all his house;<WH1004> for he is such a worthless<WH1100> fellow<WH1121> that one can't<WH1696> speak to him."

Then Abigail<WH26> hurried<WH4116> and took<WH3947> two hundred<WH3967> loaves<WH3899> of bread,<WH8147> two bottles<WH5035> of wine,<WH3196> five<WH2568> sheep<WH6629> ready dressed,<WH6213> five<WH2568> measures<WH5429> of parched<WH7039> grain,<WH3967> one hundred clusters of raisins,<WH6778> and two hundred<WH3967> cakes<WH1690> of figs,<WH7760> and laid them on donkeys.<WH2543>
She said<WH559> to her young men,<WH5288> "Go on<WH5674> before<WH6440> me.<WH935> Behold, I come after<WH310> you.<WH5046>" But she didn't tell her husband,<WH376> Nabal.<WH5037>

It was so,<WH7392> as she rode on her donkey,<WH2543> and came down<WH3381> by the covert<WH5643> of the mountain,<WH2022> that behold,<WH1732> David and his men<WH582> came down<WH3381> toward<WH7125> her;<WH6298> and she met them.

Now David<WH1732> had said,<WH559> "Surely in vain<WH8267> have I kept<WH8104> all that this<WH2088> fellow has in the wilderness,<WH4057> so that nothing<WH3972> was missed<WH6485> of all that pertained to him.<WH7725> He has returned me evil<WH7451> for good.<WH2896>

God<WH430> do<WH6213> so<WH3541> to the enemies<WH341> of David,<WH1732> and more<WH3254> also,<WH7604> if I leave of all that belongs to him by<WH5704> the morning<WH1242> light<WH216> so much as one who urinates<WH8366> on a wall.<WH7023>"

She fell<WH5307> at his feet,<WH7272> and said,<WH559> "On me,<WH113> my lord, on me be the iniquity;<WH5771> and please let your handmaid<WH519> speak<WH1696> in your ears.<WH241> Hear<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of your handmaid.<WH589>

Please don't<WH7760> let my lord<WH113> regard<WH3820> this worthless<WH1100> fellow,<WH376> even Nabal;<WH5037> for as his name<WH8034> is,<WH5037> so is he. Nabal is his name,<WH8034> and folly<WH5039> is with him;<WH519> but I, your handmaid, didn't<WH7200> see the young men<WH5288> of my lord,<WH113> whom you sent.<WH7971>

Now therefore,<WH113> my lord, as Yahweh<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> and as your soul<WH5315> lives,<WH2416> since Yahweh<WH3068> has withheld<WH4513> you from<WH935> blood<WH1818> guiltiness,<WH3467> and from avenging yourself with your own hand,<WH3027> now therefore let your enemies,<WH341> and those who seek<WH1245> evil<WH7451> to my lord,<WH113> be as Nabal.<WH5037>
Now this present<WH1293> which your servant<WH8198> has brought<WH935> to my lord,<WH113> let it be given<WH5414> to the young men<WH5288> who follow<WH1980> my lord.<WH113>

Please forgive<WH5375> the trespass<WH6588> of your handmaid.<WH519> For Yahweh<WH3068> will certainly<WH6213> make<WH6213> my lord<WH3068> a sure<WH539> house,<WH1004> because my lord<WH113> fights<WH3898> the battles<WH4421> of Yahweh;<WH113> and evil<WH7451> shall not be found<WH4672> in you all your days.<WH3117>

Though men<WH120> may rise<WH6965> up to pursue<WH7291> you,<WH1245> and to seek your soul,<WH5315> yet the soul<WH5315> of my lord<WH113> shall be bound<WH6887> in the bundle<WH6872> of life<WH2416> with Yahweh<WH3068> your God.<WH430> He will sling out<WH7049> the souls<WH5315> of your enemies,<WH341> as from the hollow<WH8432> of a sling.<WH7050>

It shall come to pass,<WH3068> when Yahweh has done<WH6213> to my lord<WH3068> according to all the good<WH2896> that he has spoken<WH1696> concerning you,<WH6680> and shall have appointed you prince<WH5057> over Israel,<WH3478>

that this shall be no grief<WH6330> to you,<WH4383> nor offense of heart<WH3820> to my lord,<WH113> either that you have shed<WH8210> blood<WH1818> without cause,<WH2600> or that my lord<WH113> has avenged<WH3467> himself.<WH113> When Yahweh has dealt well<WH3190> with my lord,<WH3068> then remember<WH2142> your handmaid.<WH519>"
David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abigail,<WH26> "Blessed<WH1288> is Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> who sent<WH7971> you this day<WH3117> to meet me!<WH7125>

Blessed<WH1288> is your discretion,<WH2940> and blessed<WH1288> are you,<WH3607> that have kept me this day<WH3117> from<WH935> blood<WH1818> guiltiness,<WH3467> and from avenging myself with my own hand.<WH3027>

For indeed,<WH199> as Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> lives,<WH2416> who has withheld<WH4513> me from hurting<WH7489> you,<WH3884> unless you had hurried<WH4116> and come<WH935> to meet<WH7125> me,<WH3498> surely there wouldn't have been left to Nabal<WH5037> by the morning<WH1242> light<WH216> so much as one who urinates<WH8366> on a wall.<WH7023>"

So David<WH1732> received<WH3947> of her hand<WH3027> that which she had brought<WH935> him:<WH559> and he said to her,<WH5927> "Go up in peace<WH7965> to your house.<WH1004> Behold,<WH7200> I have listened<WH8085> to your voice,<WH6963> and have granted<WH5375> your request.<WH6440>"

Abigail<WH26> came<WH935> to Nabal;<WH5037> and behold,<WH4960> he held a feast in his house,<WH1004> like the feast<WH4960> of a king.<WH4428> Nabal<WH5037>'s heart<WH3820> was merry<WH2896> within him,<WH3966> for he was very drunken.<WH7910> Therefore she told<WH5046> him nothing,<WH1697> less<WH6996> or more,<WH1419> until the morning<WH1242> light.<WH216>
